required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Integrated Home Dialysis Model

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate which home dialysis modality pattern (home hemodialysis [HHD], peritoneal dialysis [PD] or a combination of both, e.g. PD and then HHD) allows for the longest home dialysis survival, as defined by the time dialysed in a home environment. The investigators hypothesize that patients transferred from one home modality to another will have a longer home dialysis survival compared to patients treated only with PD or HHD.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Survival analysis; specific analysis at 5 years after dialysis initiation
primary_outcome.description: Time to first patient death or home dialysis technique failure for each home dialysis modalities, censored for transplantation and loss to follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient survival, censored for technique failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Survival analysis, specific analysis at 1,2 5 years after dialysis initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Patient survival on each specific home dialysis modality, censored for technique failure, transplantation and loss to follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Home technique survival, censored for death
secondary_outcome.time_frame: survival analysis, specific analysis at 1,2 5 years after dialysis initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Home dialysis technique survival for each home dialysis modality, censored for patient death, transplantation and loss to follow-up

other_outcome.time_frame: survival analysis, specific analysis at 1,2 5 years after dialysis initiation
other_outcome.description: Case-control analysis will be performed in order to address immortal bias in patients classified in the "switching"categories (PD-HHD or HHD-PD). Since we expect the HHD-PD group to be small, this analysis will be performed only with the 3 other groups (PD-HHD, PD only and HHD only). Patients treated successively with PD and HHD (cases) will be matched (by age and diabetes status) to patient treated with PD only and HHD only (controls).

arm_group.description: Patient on PD modality 90 days after renal replacement therapy initiation and not transferred to HHD
Patient on HHD 90 days after renal replacement therapy initiation and not transferred to PD
Patient on PD 90 days after RRT initiation and transferred to HHD less than 90 days after PD failure
Patient on HHD after RRT initiation and transferred to PD less than 90 days after HHD failure

study_pop.textblock: Patients with home dialysis as the first renal replacement therapy [RRT] modality (defined by the dialysis modality at 90 days) in Australia and New Zealand as reported in Australia and New Zealand Dialysis and Transplant Registry [ANZDATA]

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with PD/HHD 90 days after RRT initiation between January 1, 2000 and December 31, 2012 reported in ANZDATA
- â‰¥ 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 90 days of dialysis
- < 18 years
- Patients transferred to Australia/New Zealand after initiation of dialysis in another country

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Metro South and Ipswich Nephrology and Transplant Services (MINTS) Medical Director, Queensland Renal Transplant Services Professor of Medicine (University of Qld)
